title: Tiki me spiffy!
content:
Does anyone know any Hawaiian type designers, and typical Hawaiian typefaces, aside from the Font Diner and House stuff?   
   
Like in, historic art, culture, that stuff.   
   
Cheers, err.. Mahalo!
author: frankjonen

comments.content: Maybe ' [Kon Tiki Aloha](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052908/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0001001)', ' [Kon Tiki Hula](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052908/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000028)' or ' [Kon Tiki Lanai](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052908/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000030)', and others, from [Jukebox Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052908/http:/www.veer.com/products/vendor.aspx?vendor=JBT).?

not Hawaiian, but polynesian at least:   
   
 [Joseph Churchward](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052908/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/churchward/) author of [these fine types](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052908/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/churchward/). Check out Ta Tiki and Maori. love those two!

All pretty nice, but with "Like in, historic art, culture, that stuff." I was hoping to see some local art. Hawaiian typedesigners' stuff, maybe even good Hawaiian fonts with their special accents.   
   
As fond as I may be of the Tiki Room places, that's not exactly what I was looking for, but I may buy those anyway (THANKS!) ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052908im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
